ca.uqac.lif.cep

Class SmartFork

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SmartFork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable

    public final class SmartFork
extends Processor
    Duplicates an input event into two or more output traces. Contrarily to the Fork, the "smart" fork assumes an input arity of 1, and uses that to optimize the internal buffering of input events into the output queues. (Events are kept into a single queue, rather than be copied into n output queues.) For input arity 1, this object is preferred over Fork, as it otherwise behaves in exactly the same way.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Field Detail

      • m_cursors

        protected int[] m_cursors
        A set of cursors, i.e. pointers to the input buffer. For a fork of output arity n, there are n cursors.

      • s_cleanInterval

        protected static final int s_cleanInterval
        After how many calls to pull() or push() do we call the cleanup of the input queue
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_timeSinceLastClean

        protected int m_timeSinceLastClean
        How many calls to pull() or push() since last cleanup of the input queue

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public SmartFork clone()
        Specified by:
        clone in class Processor

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Resets the processor. This has for effect of flushing the contents of all input and output event queues. If the processor has an internal state, this should also reset this state to its "initial" settings (whatever that means in your context).
        Overrides:
        reset in class Processor

      • putInQueue

        public void putInQueue(Object o)
        Directly puts an event in the fork's input queue. Note that this bypasses the normal flow of events between processors, and should be used with much caution.
        Parameters:
        o - The event to insert

      • getPushableInput

        public Pushable getPushableInput(int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Returns the Pushable corresponding to the processor's i-th input trace.
        Specified by:
        getPushableInput in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index. Should be between 0 and the processor's input arity - 1 (since indices start at 0).
        Returns:
        The pushable if the index is within the appropriate range, null otherwise.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The pullable if the index is within the appropriate range, null otherwise.
